ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
sillywalk is a Python library for statistical modeling of human motion and
anthropometric data with the AnyBody Modeling System. It implements Maximum
Likelihood Principal Component Analysis (ML‑PCA) to learn compact,
low‑dimensional models from datasets, predict missing or individualized
signals from partial inputs, and export those predictions as AnyScript
include files that plug directly into AnyBody models.
about.summary: Library for maximum likelihood principal component analysis for AnyBody models

about.description:
sillywalk is a Python library for statistical modeling of human motion and
anthropometric data with the AnyBody Modeling System. It implements Maximum
Likelihood Principal Component Analysis (ML‑PCA) to learn compact,
low‑dimensional models from datasets, predict missing or individualized
signals from partial inputs, and export those predictions as AnyScript
include files that plug directly into AnyBody models.
about.summary: Library for maximum likelihood principal component analysis for AnyBody models

name: sillywalk
raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: sillywalk
  version: "1.1.1"
  python_min: "3.11"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/${{ name[0] }}/${{ name }}/${{ name }}-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 631a3b241b338e7d56b215c55cde1d9a3598b3c3edb4d9a056c5951b810499fe

build:
  noarch: python
  script: python -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - pip
    - uv
    - uv-build

  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - numpy
    - scikit-learn
    - narwhals
    - jinja2

tests:
  - python:
      python_version:
        - ${{ python_min }}.*
      imports:
        - sillywalk

about:
  homepage: https://github.com/AnyBody-Research-Group/sillywalk
  summary: 'Library for maximum likelihood principal component analysis for AnyBody models'
  description: |
    sillywalk is a Python library for statistical modeling of human motion and
    anthropometric data with the AnyBody Modeling System. It implements Maximum
    Likelihood Principal Component Analysis (ML‑PCA) to learn compact,
    low‑dimensional models from datasets, predict missing or individualized
    signals from partial inputs, and export those predictions as AnyScript
    include files that plug directly into AnyBody models.

  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  documentation: https://github.com/AnyBody-Research-Group/sillywalk
  repository: https://github.com/AnyBody-Research-Group/sillywalk

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - melund
